author: Special Correspondent
text:
A case of sexual harassment has been filed against the conductor of a private bus who allegedly tried to touch a 23-year-old female passenger inappropriately.

The woman, who was travelling from Goa to Bengaluru, has also accused the driver of supporting the conductor when she raised an alarm and alerted other passengers during the journey. Based on her complaint, the Upparpet police have registered a case against the driver and the conductor, who are absconding. The woman studies in a city college and was returning from Goa on January 2 when the incident took place. In her complaint she stated that while she was sleeping in her berth, the conductor touched her inappropriately. She woke up and found the conductor standing next to her. Upon objecting to his behaviour he started arguing with her. She demanded that the driver stop the bus, but he allegedly paid no heed to her. As soon as the bus reached Upparpet, she lodged a complaint with the police. A senior police officer said, “We have taken up the case and also enquired with the SRS Travels who have provided the details about conductor and driver.”
title: Conductor booked on the charge of misbehaving with woman passenger
